alert.note: Alert for Knott; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Letcher, southeastern Perry, southeastern Knott and southwestern Pike Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Red Star, or 10 miles west of Whitesburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... David, Carbon Glow, Jeremiah, Hot Spot, Premium and Redfox around 305 PM EDT. Van, Tillie, Isom, Sackett, Trailer, Amelia, Whitco, Oscaloosa, Ice and Dongola around 310 PM EDT. Whitesburg, Southdown, Polly, Crown, Bellcraft, Lester, Marlowe, Colly, Ermine and Colson around 315 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Craftsville, Millstone, Farraday, Seco, Winters, Thornton, Sergent, Wright, Lucastown, Mayking, Fleming-Neon, Cromona, Haymond, Lowndes, Tolliver Town, Chip, Neon Junction, Potters Fork, Hemphill, Whitaker and Dunham. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
